name: ELUCIREM
indications: eluciremtm indicated adult pediatric patients aged 2 years older magnetic resonance imaging ( mri ) detect visualize lesions abnormal vascularity : central nervous system ( brain , spine , associated tissues ) , body ( head neck , thorax , abdomen , pelvis , musculoskeletal system ) .
contraindications: recommended dose adult pediatric patients aged 2 years older 0.05 mmol/kg actual body weight ( equivalent 0.1 ml/kg ) administered intravenously approximately 2 ml/sec . ( 2.1 )

adverseReactions: elucirem contraindicated patients history hypersensitivity elucirem .
indications_original:
ELUCIREMTM is indicated in adult and pediatric patients aged 2 years and older for use with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to detect and visualize lesions with abnormal vascularity in:
                  
                     the central nervous system (brain, spine, and associated tissues),
                     the body (head and neck, thorax, abdomen, pelvis, and musculoskeletal system).
contraindications_original: The recommended dose for adult and pediatric patients aged 2 years and older is 0.05 mmol/kg actual body weight (equivalent to 0.1 mL/kg) administered intravenously at approximately 2 mL/sec. ( 2.1 )

                     Storage and Handling
                     Store at 25°C (77°F); excursions permitted from 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP, Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Do not freeze Pre-filled syringes.
adverseReactions_original: ELUCIREM is contraindicated in patients with history of hypersensitivity reactions to ELUCIREM.
